Thrilled to help drive Angel One‚Äôs performance review transformation through PeopleCues, delivering faster and smarter AI-powered feedback.
PeopleCues
PeopleCues
735 followers
735 followers
6-week review cycles were the norm. Until now.

At Angel One, performance reviews that once took 4‚Äì6 weeks now wrap up in just 2‚Äì4, and that shift means everything. Huge thanks to Angel One team for the kind words, and for recognizing what we truly care about:
üìà ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve moved the needle on the metrics that matter in a performance review.‚Äù ‚Äì
ü§ñ ‚ÄúThe AI-led SBI feedback engine has completely changed the quality of feedback.‚Äù ‚Äì

It‚Äôs a reminder that meaningful change at work doesn‚Äôt need to be loud, just well-designed.
If a better review experience helps employees feel heard and managers make sharper decisions, we‚Äôre doing our job right.

What‚Äôs one underrated shift that‚Äôs made a big difference in your org? Comment below.

1mo ‚Ä¢ 
 1 month ago ‚Ä¢ Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn
üß† What if your code could write its own tests, just by running?

I‚Äôve been exploring a feedback loop between runtime behavior and AI-powered test generation, and I think it‚Äôs worth building out.

üîç The idea
I use snoop (https://lnkd.in/gThk5c7c), a lightweight Python tracer, to log every line of code execution, variables, control flow, and function calls.

Then I feed those logs into an LLM like Claude Opus 4.

The AI reads the trace and starts:
üß™ Suggesting test cases based on real execution paths
üß† Spotting assertion gaps and missing invariants
‚ùó Flagging logic bugs buried in branching logic

üî• Why this matters
Most bugs don‚Äôt show up in CI.
They emerge when real users hit real systems under real conditions.

Think:
üîÑ Feed-ranking APIs where cache invalidation races with updates
üßµ Retry logic that silently breaks idempotency
üéõÔ∏è Feature-flagged branches no one thought to test

Runtime is the truth. Tests are just guesses.

So I‚Äôm flipping the model: Let the system tell me what I forgot to validate.

‚öôÔ∏è The pipeline I'm testing
‚ûï Add @snoop to core infra modules
üì¶ Capture logs from real or test runs

üß† Run a small Python script that:
Parses the trace
Reconstructs execution flow
Emits test suggestions in Markdown or JSON
üõ†Ô∏è (Optional) Plug into CI to flag missed test coverage

‚û°Ô∏è Runtime ‚Üí Trace ‚Üí Test

Every execution becomes a learning artifact.

üå± The long-term vision

ü§ñ An AI observability agent that flags missing test cases live
üìà A test suite that evolves with real traffic
üîÅ A tighter loop between dev, runtime, and QA
üí¨ Want to jam on this over the weekend?

If you're into systems, tracing, test automation, or AI-for-engineering, let‚Äôs pair.

Just enough time to sketch a working POC or shape it into a tiny OSS tool.

‚Ä¶more
